main event: On March 7, 1951 at McClellan AFB in California, a witness sighted a cylindrical, silver gray object about 30 ft in diameter, at an altitude of 2,000 ft, which then moved at incredible speed and disappeared in less than a minute. No other aircraft were in the vicinity of the object, and there were no solar reflections or meteorological phenomena reported.
interesting points: The witness observed the object from a car and described it as round, cylindrical, and about 30 ft in diameter, with no reflection from the sun on the object.
The object turned in a northerly direction and moved at incredible speed, becoming a speck in about a minute, disappearing from the witness's vision.
No other persons reported such an object that day and no articles appeared in the local newspaper about it.
The weather that day was clear and cloudless with light winds and unlimited visibility.
The report was downgraded at 3-year intervals and declassified after 12 years.
sighted object: cylindrical, silver gray object about 30 ft in diameter
